titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Connecticut Public Health Association Records
titlestmt.author: compiled by Christine Connolly and Carol King

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Saturday December 8, 2018 at 10:30

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The records document the history of the Connecticut Public Health Association (1974) and its predecessors. Most materials date from 1946-1993 and consist of correspondence, minutes, bylaws, constitutions, newsletters, officers' reports, and memoranda relating to the business of the organizations. These papers form part of the Contemporary Medical Care and Health Policy Collection.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of the Connecticut Public Health Association, 1981 and 1995.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright has been transferred to Yale University for unpublished materials authored or otherwise produced by the creator(s) of this collection. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Connecticut Public Health Association Records (MS 1251). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Connecticut Public Health Association (C.P.H.A.) is a private organization for individuals with professional or personal interest in public health and for state-wide organizations in health-related fields. It was founded in 1974 through a merger of the Connecticut Public Health Association and the Connecticut Health League (C.H.L.). The new organization was originally named the Connecticut Health Association, Inc., but reverted to the name of the larger of the two parent organizations in 1978. The original C.P.H.A. was founded in 1916 to protect and promote public health and safety in Connecticut. The C.H.L. developed out of a C.P.H.A. committee appointed to explore the need for a council to coordinate state health agencies. The C.H.L. was formed in 1951.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The records document the history of the Connecticut Public Health Association (1974) and its predecessors. Most materials date from 1946-1993 and consist of correspondence, minutes, bylaws, constitutions, newsletters, officers' reports, and memoranda relating to the business of the organizations. These papers form part of the Contemporary Medical Care and Health Policy Collection.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The materials are arranged by organization name.

scopecontent.p: Materials have been removed from binders.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Documents the formation of the League, Conference on Aging, Health Careers project, and relations with the National Health Council. Secretary's books include correspondence, minutes, and reports.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes Connecticut School Health Council, Alcoholism Study, and other projects.

scopecontent.p: Includes information on merger with CPHA.

did.unittitle: Material documenting formation of Connecticut Health Association and early operations

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: CHA name changed to CPHA in 1978.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The bulk of the material dates from 1978-1993 and consists of minutes of meetings, committee reports, newsletters, and financial statements of the Connecticut Public Health Association (CPHA). There is also some material of the CPHA from 1950-1974, and a small quantity of material which dates from the time of the merger of the CPHA and the Connecticut Health League and from the first years of the association when it was known as the Connecticut Health Association.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The files are arranged by year and then by type of material, as received from the Connecticut Public Health Association.
